title: The next general election must turn a page on this wretched chapter in UK politics
text:
It has been a long week in British politics but little has actually changed. Seven days ago, the Government had a withdrawal deal agreed with the EU and planned to leave by October 31. It looked like it might actually, finally, do it. Then MPs passed the Letwin amendment – meaning that Parliament would withhold support for the deal until the relevant legislation had passed – so the Government withdrew its meaningful vote.

Parliament then debated the legislation and voted its assent, but immediately rejected the Government’s timetable. Realising that MPs meant to amend the Withdrawal Agreement Bill to the point that it was not Brexit at all, the Government withdrew this, too. “Can we at least...
description: It has been a long week in British politics but little has actually changed.
